peregrinator's blog http://localhost:1313/ Recent content on peregrinator's blog Hugo <<<<<<< HEAD en The content for this site is [CC-BY-SA 4.0](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/), the [source code](https://git.sr.ht/~peregrinator/peregrinator.site) for this site is [MIT](https://git.sr.ht/~peregrinator/peregrinator.site/tree/main/item/LICENSE) ======= en-us 2012-2023 Brihadeesh S All rights reserved >>>>>>> df32890 (last commit before move) Thu, 23 Jan 2025 12:41:00 +0530 What even is skramz <<<<<<< HEAD http://localhost:1313/blog/2025/01/what-even-is-skramz/ Thu, 23 Jan 2025 12:41:00 +0530 http://localhost:1313/blog/2025/01/what-even-is-skramz/ No more EOY lists for music http://localhost:1313/blog/2025/01/no-more-eoy-lists-for-music/ Wed, 15 Jan 2025 20:23:00 +0530 http://localhost:1313/blog/2025/01/no-more-eoy-lists-for-music/ ======= http://localhost:1313/blog/2025/01/what-even-is-skramz.html Thu, 23 Jan 2025 12:41:00 +0530 http://localhost:1313/blog/2025/01/what-even-is-skramz.html

The last week has been eventful and has seen a ton of new releases out of which I’ve listened to probably just an album or two. There was a toilet themed slam band that put out something with some really sick riffs. There was the album from Serein that used a painting by Thomas Cole called “The Voyage of Life: Old Age” from 1942 as their cover art. Most people that checked it out, complained that it had clean vocals, something not everyone appreciates in death metal.

No more EOY lists for music http://localhost:1313/blog/2025/01/no-more-eoy-lists-for-music.html Wed, 15 Jan 2025 20:23:00 +0530 http://localhost:1313/blog/2025/01/no-more-eoy-lists-for-music.html

It’s been a while since I wrote for the blog and even longer since I made an end-of-year list but I’ve been thinking about these lists. I’ve published just one from a couple of years back and then never really published one on the blog and it has been something of a conscious decision. I would perhaps like to move towards writing more meaningful pieces on individual albums or sets of albums I’ve been listening to and have gotten to appreciate. Making EOY lists has been exhausting and I’m never entirely sure if I’ve missed out on any albums since I don’t really keep track of what I really enjoyed.
